00418 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING

00420 {
00421     if (!(
00422           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset == 0)))))
00423         cvmx_warn("CVMX_SPEMX_PF2_DBG_INFO(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00424     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800C0000248ull);
00425 }
00426 #else
00427 #define CVMX_SPEMX_PF2_DBG_INFO(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800C0000248ull))
00428 #endif

00431 {
00432     if (!(
00433           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) && ((offset == 0)))))

00435     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x00011800C0000180ull);
00436 }
00437 #else

00439 #endif

00488                                                          Enumerated by SLI_ENDIANSWAP_E. */
00489     uint64_t addr_v                       : 1;  /**< Address valid. Set to 1 when the selected address range is valid. */

00494     uint64_t addr_idx                     : 20;
00495     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
00496 #endif
00497     } s;
00498     struct cvmx_spemx_bar1_indexx_s       cn73xx;
00499 };

00516 #else

00518     uint64_t mask                         : 39;
00519     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
00520 #endif
00521     } s;

00538                                                          0x0 = Reserved.

00548                                                          Enumerated by SLI_ENDIANSWAP_E. */

00550                                                          L2 if XOR result is 1. */

00553     uint64_t bar2_esx                     : 2;

00557 #endif
00558     } s;

00616 /**
00617  * cvmx_spem#_cfg
00618  *
00619  * Configuration of the PCIe Application.
00620  *
00621  */
00622 union cvmx_spemx_cfg {
00623     uint64_t u64;
00624     struct cvmx_spemx_cfg_s {
00625 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00626     uint64_t reserved_5_63                : 59;
00627     uint64_t laneswap                     : 1;  /**< This field enables overwriting the value for lane swapping. The reset value is captured on
00628                                                          cold reset by the pin straps (see PEM()_STRAP[PILANESWAP]). When set, lane swapping is
00629                                                          performed to/from the SerDes. When clear, no lane swapping is performed. */
00630     uint64_t lanes8                       : 1;  /**< This field enables overwriting the value for the maximum number of lanes. The reset value
00631                                                          is captured on cold reset by the pin straps (see PEM()_STRAP[PILANES8]). When set, the
00632                                                          PEM is configured for a maximum of 8 lanes when connected to a QLM. When clear, the PEM
00633                                                          is configured for a maximum of 4 lanes when connected to a QLM. When the PEM is connected
00634                                                          to a DLM, this field is unused, the number of lanes is 2.
00635                                                          This value, along with PEM()_QLM[PEMDLMMUX], is used to set the maximum link width field
00636                                                          in the core's
00637                                                          link capabilities register (CFG031) to indicate the maximum number of lanes
00638                                                          supported. Note that less lanes than the specified maximum can be configured for use via
00639                                                          the core's link control register (CFG032) negotiated link width field. */
00640     uint64_t hostmd                       : 1;  /**< This field enables overwriting the value for host mode. The reset value is captured on
00641                                                          cold reset by the pin straps. (See PEM()_STRAP[PIMODE]. The HOSTMD reset value is the
00642                                                          bit-wise AND of the PIMODE straps.  As such, PEMs 0 and 2 are configurable and PEMs 1
00643                                                          and 3 default to 0x1.)  When set, the PEM is configured to be a root complex. When clear,
00644                                                          the PEM is configured to be an end point.
00645                                                          Because SPEM0 and PEM2 share an EEPROM, the PEM2_CFG[HOSTMD] should only be changed by
00646                                                          software when SPEM0 is in reset. */
00647     uint64_t md                           : 2;  /**< This field enables overwriting the value for speed. The reset value is captured on cold
00648                                                          reset by the pin straps (see PEM()_STRAP[PIMODE]). For a root complex configuration
00649                                                          that is not running at Gen3 speed, the HOSTMD bit of this register must be set when this
00650                                                          field is changed.
00651                                                          0x0 = Gen1 speed.
00652                                                          0x1 = Gen2 speed.
00653                                                          0x2 = Gen3 speed.
00654                                                          0x3 = Reserved. */
00655 #else
00656     uint64_t md                           : 2;
00657     uint64_t hostmd                       : 1;
00658     uint64_t lanes8                       : 1;
00659     uint64_t laneswap                     : 1;
00660     uint64_t reserved_5_63                : 59;
00661 #endif
00662     } s;
00663     struct cvmx_spemx_cfg_s               cn73xx;
00664 };
00665 typedef union cvmx_spemx_cfg cvmx_spemx_cfg_t;
00666 
00667 /**
00668  * cvmx_spem#_cfg_rd
00669  *
00670  * This register allows read access to the configuration in the PCIe core.
00671  *
00672  */
00673 union cvmx_spemx_cfg_rd {
00674     uint64_t u64;
00675     struct cvmx_spemx_cfg_rd_s {
00676 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00677     uint64_t data                         : 32; /**< Data. */
00678     uint64_t addr                         : 32; /**< Address to read. A write to this register starts a read operation.
00679                                                          Following are the subfields of the ADDR field.
00680                                                          <31:26> Reserved. Must be zero.
00681                                                          <25:24> The physical function number accessed by the read. 0..2 are legal
00682                                                                  values in EP mode. Must be zero in RC mode.
00683                                                          <23>    When clear, the read accesses a physical function. When set,
00684                                                                  the read accesses the virtual function selected by <22:12>.
00685                                                                  Must be zero when SR-IOV is not used in the physical function.
00686                                                                  Must be zero in RC mode.
00687                                                          <22:12> The selected virtual function. Must be zero when <23> is
00688                                                                  clear. Must be zero in RC mode. 0..63 are legal values for
00689                                                                  PF0 and PF1. 0..1026 are legal values for PF2.
00690                                                          <11:0>  Selects the PCIe config space register being read in the
00691                                                                  function. */
00692 #else
00693     uint64_t addr                         : 32;
00694     uint64_t data                         : 32;
00695 #endif
00696     } s;
00697     struct cvmx_spemx_cfg_rd_s            cn73xx;
00698 };
00699 typedef union cvmx_spemx_cfg_rd cvmx_spemx_cfg_rd_t;

00701 /**
00702  * cvmx_spem#_cfg_wr
00703  *
00704  * This register allows write access to the configuration in the PCIe core.
00705  *
00706  */
00707 union cvmx_spemx_cfg_wr {
00708     uint64_t u64;
00709     struct cvmx_spemx_cfg_wr_s {
00710 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00711     uint64_t data                         : 32; /**< Data to write. A write to this register starts a write operation. */
00712     uint64_t addr                         : 32; /**< Address to write. A write to this register starts a write operation.
00713                                                          Following are the subfields of the ADDR field.
00714                                                          <31>    When clear, the write is the same as a config space write received
00715                                                                  from external. When set, the write can modify more fields than
00716                                                                  an external write could (i.e. configuration mask register).
00717                                                                  Corresponds to the CS2 field in Byte2 of the EEPROM.
00718                                                          <30:26> Reserved. Must be zero.
00719                                                          <25:24> The physical function number accessed by the write. 0..2 are legal
00720                                                                  values in EP mode. Must be zero in RC mode.
00721                                                          <23>    When clear, the write accesses a physical function. When set,
00722                                                                  the write accesses the virtual function selected by <22:12>.
00723                                                                  Must be zero when SR-IOV is not used in the physical function.
00724                                                                  Must be zero in RC mode.
00725                                                          <22:12> The selected virtual function. Must be zero when <23> is
00726                                                                  clear. Must be zero in RC mode. 0..63 are legal values for
00727                                                                  PF0 and PF1. 0..1026 are legal values for PF2.
00728                                                          <11:0>  Selects the PCIe config space register being written in the
00729                                                                  function. */
00730 #else
00731     uint64_t addr                         : 32;
00732     uint64_t data                         : 32;
00733 #endif
00734     } s;

00785 /**
00786  * cvmx_spem#_ctl_status
00787  *
00788  * This is a general control and status register of the SPEM.
00789  *
00790  */
00791 union cvmx_spemx_ctl_status {
00792     uint64_t u64;
00793     struct cvmx_spemx_ctl_status_s {
00794 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00795     uint64_t reserved_51_63               : 13;
00796     uint64_t inv_dpar                     : 1;  /**< Invert the generated parity to be written into the most significant data queue buffer RAM
00797                                                          block to force a parity error when it is later read. */
00798     uint64_t reserved_48_49               : 2;
00799     uint64_t auto_sd                      : 1;  /**< Link hardware autonomous speed disable. */
00800     uint64_t dnum                         : 5;  /**< Not used. */
00801     uint64_t pbus                         : 8;  /**< Primary bus number. In RC mode, a RO copy of the corresponding
00802                                                          PCIERC(0..3)_CFG006[PBNUM]. In EP mode, the bus number latched
00803                                                          on any type 0 configuration write. */
00804     uint64_t reserved_32_33               : 2;
00805     uint64_t cfg_rtry                     : 16; /**< The time * 0x10000 in coprocessor clocks to wait for a CPL to a configuration read that
00806                                                          does not carry a retry status. Until such time that the timeout occurs and retry status is
00807                                                          received for a configuration read, the read will be resent. A value of 0 disables retries
00808                                                          and treats a CPL Retry as a CPL UR.
00809                                                          To use, it is recommended CFG_RTRY be set value corresponding to 200 ms or less, although
00810                                                          the PCI Express Base Specification allows up to 900 ms for a device to send a successful
00811                                                          completion.  When enabled, only one CFG RD may be issued until either successful
00812                                                          completion or CPL UR. */
00813     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
00814     uint64_t pm_pf_xpme                   : 2;  /**< When written with one, a single cycle pulse is sent to the PCIe core pm_xmt_pme port.
00815                                                          EP mode.
00816                                                          <13> = PF2.
00817                                                          <12> = PF1. */
00818     uint64_t pm_xtoff                     : 1;  /**< When written with one, a single cycle pulse is sent to the PCIe core pm_xmt_turnoff port. RC mode. */
00819     uint64_t pm_xpme                      : 1;  /**< When written with one, a single cycle pulse is sent to the PCIe core pm_xmt_pme port.
00820                                                          EP mode PF0. */
00821     uint64_t ob_p_cmd                     : 3;  /**< When written with one, a single cycle pulse is sent to the PCIe core outband_pwrup_cmd
00822                                                          port. EP mode.
00823                                                          <9> = PF0.
00824                                                          <8> = PF1.
00825                                                          <7> = PF2. */
00826     uint64_t nf_ecrc                      : 1;  /**< Do not forward peer-to-peer ECRC TLPs. */
00827     uint64_t dly_one                      : 1;  /**< When set the output client state machines will wait one cycle before starting a new TLP out. */
00828     uint64_t lnk_enb                      : 1;  /**< When set, the link is enabled; when clear (0) the link is disabled. This bit only is
00829                                                          active when in RC mode. */
00830     uint64_t ro_ctlp                      : 1;  /**< When set, C-TLPs that have the RO bit set will not wait for P-TLPs that are normally sent first. */
00831     uint64_t fast_lm                      : 1;  /**< When set, forces fast link mode. */
00832     uint64_t inv_ecrc                     : 1;  /**< When set, causes the LSB of the ECRC to be inverted. */
00833     uint64_t inv_lcrc                     : 1;  /**< When set, causes the LSB of the LCRC to be inverted. */
00834 #else
00835     uint64_t inv_lcrc                     : 1;
00836     uint64_t inv_ecrc                     : 1;
00837     uint64_t fast_lm                      : 1;
00838     uint64_t ro_ctlp                      : 1;
00839     uint64_t lnk_enb                      : 1;
00840     uint64_t dly_one                      : 1;
00841     uint64_t nf_ecrc                      : 1;
00842     uint64_t ob_p_cmd                     : 3;
00843     uint64_t pm_xpme                      : 1;
00844     uint64_t pm_xtoff                     : 1;
00845     uint64_t pm_pf_xpme                   : 2;
00846     uint64_t reserved_14_15               : 2;
00847     uint64_t cfg_rtry                     : 16;
00848     uint64_t reserved_32_33               : 2;
00849     uint64_t pbus                         : 8;
00850     uint64_t dnum                         : 5;
00851     uint64_t auto_sd                      : 1;
00852     uint64_t reserved_48_49               : 2;
00853     uint64_t inv_dpar                     : 1;
00854     uint64_t reserved_51_63               : 13;
00855 #endif
00856     } s;
00857     struct cvmx_spemx_ctl_status_s        cn73xx;
00858 };
00859 typedef union cvmx_spemx_ctl_status cvmx_spemx_ctl_status_t;
00860 
00861 /**
00862  * cvmx_spem#_ctl_status2
00863  *
00864  * This register contains additional general control and status of the SPEM.
00865  *
00866  */
00867 union cvmx_spemx_ctl_status2 {
00868     uint64_t u64;
00869     struct cvmx_spemx_ctl_status2_s {
00870 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00871     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
00872     uint64_t no_fwd_prg                   : 16; /**< The time * 0x10000 in core clocks to wait for the TLP FIFOs to be able to unload an entry.
00873                                                          If there is no forward progress, such that the timeout occurs, credits are returned to the
00874                                                          SLI and an interrupt (if enabled) is asserted. Any more TLPs received are dropped on the
00875                                                          floor and the credits associated with those TLPs are returned as well. Note that 0xFFFF is
00876                                                          a reserved value that will put the PEM in the 'forward progress stopped' state
00877                                                          immediately. This state holds until a MAC reset is received. */
00878 #else
00879     uint64_t no_fwd_prg                   : 16;
00880     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
00881 #endif
00882     } s;
00883     struct cvmx_spemx_ctl_status2_s       cn73xx;
00884 };
00885 typedef union cvmx_spemx_ctl_status2 cvmx_spemx_ctl_status2_t;
00886

00999     uint64_t rte                          : 1;  /**< Replay timer expired. This bit is set when the REPLAY_TIMER expires in the PCIe core. The
01000                                                          probability of this bit being set increases with the traffic load.

01022                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_RECRCE. */

01026                                                          if a received AtomicOp viloates address/length rules, this bit is set as well.

01030 #else

01149 /**

01154  */

01161     uint64_t qhdr_b0_ena                  : 1;  /**< ECC enable for Core's Q HDR Bank0 RAM. */

01168     uint64_t c_d0_ena                     : 1;  /**< ECC enable for TLP CPL data0 FIFO. */

01173     uint64_t p_d1_ena                     : 1;  /**< ECC enable for TLP posted data1 FIFO. */
01174     uint64_t p_d0_ena                     : 1;  /**< ECC enable for TLP posted data0 FIFO. */
01175 #else

01184     uint64_t c_c_ena                      : 1;
01185     uint64_t m2s_d_ena                    : 1;
01186     uint64_t m2s_c_ena                    : 1;
01187     uint64_t reserved_11_31               : 21;
01188     uint64_t rtry_ena                     : 1;
01189     uint64_t qhdr_b0_ena                  : 1;
01190     uint64_t qhdr_b1_ena                  : 1;
01191     uint64_t reserved_35_63               : 29;
01192 #endif
01193     } s;

01224 #else

01279                                                          Level Reset global counter will be increased (set) or decreased (not set). */

01296 
01297 /**
01298  * cvmx_spem#_flr_pf0_vf_stopreq
01299  *
01300  * PF0 virtual function level reset stop outbound requests register.
01301  * Hardware automatically sets the STOPREQ bit for the VF when it enters a
01302  * function level reset (FLR).  Software is responsible for clearing the STOPREQ
01303  * bit but must not do so prior to hardware taking down the FLR, which could be
01304  * as long as 100ms.  It may be appropriate for software to wait longer before clearing
01305  * STOPREQ, software may need to drain deep DPI queues for example.
01306  * Whenever SPEM receives a request mastered by CNXXXX over S2M (i.e. P or NP),
01307  * when STOPREQ is set for the function, SPEM will discard the outgoing request
01308  * before sending it to the PCIe core.  If a NP, SPEM will schedule an immediate
01309  * SWI_RSP_ERROR completion for the request - no timeout is required.
01310  *
01311  * STOPREQ mimics the behavior of PCIEEPVF()_CFG001[ME] for outbound requests that will
01312  * master the PCIe bus (P and NP).
01313  *
01314  * Note that STOPREQ will have no effect on completions returned by CNXXXX over the S2M,
01315  * nor on M2S traffic.
01316  */
01317 union cvmx_spemx_flr_pf0_vf_stopreq {
01318     uint64_t u64;
01319     struct cvmx_spemx_flr_pf0_vf_stopreq_s {
01320 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01321     uint64_t vf_stopreq                   : 64; /**< STOPREQ for the 64 VFs in PF0. */
01322 #else
01323     uint64_t vf_stopreq                   : 64;
01324 #endif
01325     } s;
01326     struct cvmx_spemx_flr_pf0_vf_stopreq_s cn73xx;
01327 };
01328 typedef union cvmx_spemx_flr_pf0_vf_stopreq cvmx_spemx_flr_pf0_vf_stopreq_t;
01329 
01330 /**
01331  * cvmx_spem#_flr_pf1_vf_stopreq
01332  *
01333  * PF1 virtual function level reset stop outbound requests register.
01334  * Hardware automatically sets the STOPREQ bit for the VF when it enters a
01335  * function level reset (FLR).  Software is responsible for clearing the STOPREQ
01336  * bit but must not do so prior to hardware taking down the FLR, which could be
01337  * as long as 100ms.  It may be appropriate for software to wait longer before clearing
01338  * STOPREQ, software may need to drain deep DPI queues for example.
01339  * Whenever SPEM receives a request mastered by CNXXXX over S2M (i.e. P or NP),
01340  * when STOPREQ is set for the function, SPEM will discard the outgoing request
01341  * before sending it to the PCIe core.  If a NP, SPEM will schedule an immediate
01342  * SWI_RSP_ERROR completion for the request - no timeout is required.
01343  *
01344  * STOPREQ mimics the behavior of PCIEEPVF()_CFG001[ME] for outbound requests that will
01345  * master the PCIe bus (P and NP).
01346  *
01347  * Note that STOPREQ will have no effect on completions returned by CNXXXX over the S2M,
01348  * nor on M2S traffic.
01349  */
01350 union cvmx_spemx_flr_pf1_vf_stopreq {

01363 /**
01364  * cvmx_spem#_flr_pf2_vf#_stopreq
01365  *
01366  * PF2 virtual function level reset stop outbound requests register.
01367  * Hardware automatically sets the STOPREQ bit for the VF when it enters a
01368  * function level reset (FLR).  Software is responsible for clearing the STOPREQ
01369  * bit but must not do so prior to hardware taking down the FLR, which could be
01370  * as long as 100ms.  It may be appropriate for software to wait longer before clearing
01371  * STOPREQ, software may need to drain deep DPI queues for example.
01372  * Whenever SPEM receives a request mastered by CNXXXX over S2M (i.e. P or NP),
01373  * when STOPREQ is set for the function, SPEM will discard the outgoing request
01374  * before sending it to the PCIe core.  If a NP, SPEM will schedule an immediate
01375  * SWI_RSP_ERROR completion for the request - no timeout is required.
01376  *
01377  * STOPREQ mimics the behavior of PCIEEPVF()_CFG001[ME] for outbound requests that will
01378  * master the PCIe bus (P and NP).
01379  *
01380  * Note that STOPREQ will have no effect on completions returned by CNXXXX over the S2M,
01381  * nor on M2S traffic.
01382  */
01383 union cvmx_spemx_flr_pf2_vfx_stopreq {
01384     uint64_t u64;
01385     struct cvmx_spemx_flr_pf2_vfx_stopreq_s {

01395 
01396 /**
01397  * cvmx_spem#_flr_pf_stopreq
01398  *
01399  * PF function level reset stop outbound requests register.
01400  * Hardware automatically sets the STOPREQ bit for the PF when it enters a
01401  * function level reset (FLR).  Software is responsible for clearing the STOPREQ
01402  * bit but must not do so prior to hardware taking down the FLR, which could be
01403  * as long as 100ms.  It may be appropriate for software to wait longer before clearing
01404  * STOPREQ, software may need to drain deep DPI queues for example.
01405  * Whenever SPEM receives a PF or child VF request mastered by CNXXXX over S2M (i.e. P or NP),
01406  * when STOPREQ is set for the function, SPEM will discard the outgoing request
01407  * before sending it to the PCIe core.  If a NP, SPEM will schedule an immediate
01408  * SWI_RSP_ERROR completion for the request - no timeout is required.
01409  * In both cases, SPEM()_DBG_PF()_INFO[P()_BMD_E] will be set and a error
01410  * interrupt is generated.
01411  *
01412  * STOPREQ mimics the behavior of PCIEEP()_CFG001[ME] for outbound requests that will
01413  * master the PCIe bus (P and NP).
01414  *
01415  * Note that STOPREQ will have no effect on completions returned by CNXXXX over the S2M,
01416  * nor on M2S traffic.
01417  *
01418  * Note that when a PF()_STOPREQ is set, none of the associated
01419  * PEM()_FLR_PF()_VF_STOPREQ[VF_STOPREQ]
01420  * will be set.
01421  */
01422 union cvmx_spemx_flr_pf_stopreq {
01423     uint64_t u64;
01424     struct cvmx_spemx_flr_pf_stopreq_s {
01425 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01426     uint64_t reserved_3_63                : 61;
01427     uint64_t pf2_stopreq                  : 1;  /**< PF2 STOPREQ bit. */
01428     uint64_t pf1_stopreq                  : 1;  /**< PF1 STOPREQ bit. */
01429     uint64_t pf0_stopreq                  : 1;  /**< PF0 STOPREQ bit. */
01430 #else
01431     uint64_t pf0_stopreq                  : 1;
01432     uint64_t pf1_stopreq                  : 1;
01433     uint64_t pf2_stopreq                  : 1;
01434     uint64_t reserved_3_63                : 61;
01435 #endif
01436     } s;
01437     struct cvmx_spemx_flr_pf_stopreq_s    cn73xx;
01438 };
01439 typedef union cvmx_spemx_flr_pf_stopreq cvmx_spemx_flr_pf_stopreq_t;
01440 
01441 /**
01442  * cvmx_spem#_flr_zombie_ctl

01444  * Function level reset global zombie counter control register
01445  *
01446  */
01447 union cvmx_spemx_flr_zombie_ctl {
01448     uint64_t u64;
01449     struct cvmx_spemx_flr_zombie_ctl_s {
01450 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01451     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
01452     uint64_t exp                          : 10; /**< The expiration value for the inbound shared global zombie counter. The global zombie
01453                                                          counter
01454                                                          continuously counts the number of cycles where the PCIe Core was allowed to send
01455                                                          either a Posted request or a Completion to the PEM.  When the global zombie counter
01456                                                          reaches expiration (EXP), it resets to zero and all the nonzero per PCIe tag zombie
01457                                                          counters are decremented. When a per PCIe tag zombie counter decrements to zero, a
01458                                                          SWI_RSP_ERROR is
01459                                                          sent to the M2S bus and its associated PCIe tag is returned to the pool.
01460                                                          This field allows software programmability control of the zombie counter expiration. */
01461 #else
01462     uint64_t exp                          : 10;
01463     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
01464 #endif
01465     } s;
01466     struct cvmx_spemx_flr_zombie_ctl_s    cn73xx;

01492 /**

01494  *
01495  * This register contains the different interrupt summary bits of the SPEM.

01498 union cvmx_spemx_int_sum {
01499     uint64_t u64;
01500     struct cvmx_spemx_int_sum_s {
01501 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01502     uint64_t intd                         : 1;  /**< The PCIe controller received an INTD. This is a level-sensitive interrupt. This
01503                                                          should be ignored in EP mode.
01504                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_INTD. */
01505     uint64_t intc                         : 1;  /**< The PCIe controller received an INTC. This is a level-sensitive interrupt. This
01506                                                          should be ignored in EP mode.
01507                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_INTC. */
01508     uint64_t intb                         : 1;  /**< The PCIe controller received an INTB. This is a level-sensitive interrupt. This
01509                                                          should be ignored in EP mode.
01510                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_INTB. */
01511     uint64_t inta                         : 1;  /**< The PCIe controller received an INTA. This is a level-sensitive interrupt. This
01512                                                          should be ignored in EP mode.
01513                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_INTA. */
01514     uint64_t reserved_14_59               : 46;
01515     uint64_t crs_dr                       : 1;  /**< Had a CRS timeout when retries were disabled. This should be ignored in EP mode.
01516                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_CRS_DR. */
01517     uint64_t crs_er                       : 1;  /**< Had a CRS timeout when retries were enabled. This should be ignored in EP mode.
01518                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_CRS_ER. */
01519     uint64_t rdlk                         : 1;  /**< Received read lock TLP.
01520                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_RDLK. */
01521     uint64_t un_bx                        : 1;  /**< Received N-TLP for unknown BAR.
01522                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_UN_BX. */
01523     uint64_t un_b2                        : 1;  /**< Received N-TLP for BAR2 when BAR2 is disabled.
01524                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_UN_B2. */
01525     uint64_t un_b1                        : 1;  /**< Received N-TLP for BAR1 when BAR1 index valid is not set.
01526                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_UN_B1. */
01527     uint64_t up_bx                        : 1;  /**< Received P-TLP for an unknown BAR.
01528                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_UP_BX. */
01529     uint64_t up_b2                        : 1;  /**< Received P-TLP for BAR2 when BAR2 is disabled.
01530                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_UP_B2. */
01531     uint64_t up_b1                        : 1;  /**< Received P-TLP for BAR1 when BAR1 index valid is not set.
01532                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_UP_B1. */
01533     uint64_t pf2_pmei                     : 1;  /**< PF2 PME interrupt. This is a level-sensitive interrupt.
01534                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_PF2_PMEI. */
01535     uint64_t pf1_pmei                     : 1;  /**< PF1 PME interrupt. This is a level-sensitive interrupt.
01536                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_PF1_PMEI. */
01537     uint64_t pf0_pmei                     : 1;  /**< PF0 PME interrupt. This is a level-sensitive interrupt.
01538                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_PF0_PMEI. */
01539     uint64_t se                           : 1;  /**< System error, RC mode only.
01540                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_SE. */
01541     uint64_t aeri                         : 1;  /**< Advanced error reporting interrupt, RC mode only.
01542                                                          This is a level-sensitive interrupt.
01543                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM()_ERROR_AERI. */
01544 #else
01545     uint64_t aeri                         : 1;
01546     uint64_t se                           : 1;
01547     uint64_t pf0_pmei                     : 1;
01548     uint64_t pf1_pmei                     : 1;
01549     uint64_t pf2_pmei                     : 1;
01550     uint64_t up_b1                        : 1;
01551     uint64_t up_b2                        : 1;
01552     uint64_t up_bx                        : 1;
01553     uint64_t un_b1                        : 1;
01554     uint64_t un_b2                        : 1;
01555     uint64_t un_bx                        : 1;
01556     uint64_t rdlk                         : 1;
01557     uint64_t crs_er                       : 1;
01558     uint64_t crs_dr                       : 1;

01560     uint64_t inta                         : 1;
01561     uint64_t intb                         : 1;
01562     uint64_t intc                         : 1;

01564 #endif
01565     } s;

01591 /**
01592  * cvmx_spem#_nqm_tlp_credits
01593  *
01594  * This register specifies the number of credits for use in moving inbound TLPs. When this
01595  * register is
01596  * written, the credit values are reset to the register value. A write to this register should
01597  * take place before traffic flow starts.
01598  */
01599 union cvmx_spemx_nqm_tlp_credits {
01600     uint64_t u64;
01601     struct cvmx_spemx_nqm_tlp_credits_s {
01602 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01603     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
01604     uint64_t nqm_cpl                      : 8;  /**< TLP 8 B credits for completion TLPs in the NQM. Legal values are 0x24 to 0xFF. */
01605     uint64_t nqm_np                       : 8;  /**< TLP 8 B credits for nonposted TLPs in the NQM. Legal values are 0x4 to 0x10. */
01606     uint64_t nqm_p                        : 8;  /**< TLP 8 B credits for Posted TLPs in the NQM. Legal values are 0x24 to 0x3F. */
01607 #else
01608     uint64_t nqm_p                        : 8;
01609     uint64_t nqm_np                       : 8;
01610     uint64_t nqm_cpl                      : 8;
01611     uint64_t reserved_24_63               : 40;
01612 #endif
01613     } s;
01614     struct cvmx_spemx_nqm_tlp_credits_s   cn73xx;
01615 };
01616 typedef union cvmx_spemx_nqm_tlp_credits cvmx_spemx_nqm_tlp_credits_t;
01617 
01618 /**
01619  * cvmx_spem#_on
01620  *
01621  * This register indicates that SPEM is configured and ready.
01622  *
01623  */
01624 union cvmx_spemx_on {
01625     uint64_t u64;
01626     struct cvmx_spemx_on_s {
01627 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01628     uint64_t reserved_2_63                : 62;
01629     uint64_t pemoor                       : 1;  /**< Indication to software that the PEM has been taken out of reset (i.e. BIST is done) and it
01630                                                          is safe to configure core CSRs. */
01631     uint64_t pemon                        : 1;  /**< Indication to the QLM that the PEM is out of reset, configured, and ready to send/receive
01632                                                          traffic. Setting this bit takes the configured PIPE out of reset. */
01633 #else
01634     uint64_t pemon                        : 1;
01635     uint64_t pemoor                       : 1;
01636     uint64_t reserved_2_63                : 62;
01637 #endif
01638     } s;
01639     struct cvmx_spemx_on_s                cn73xx;
01640 };
01641 typedef union cvmx_spemx_on cvmx_spemx_on_t;

01756 /**
01757  * cvmx_spem#_pf1_dbg_info
01758  *
01759  * This is PF1 debug information register of the SPEM.
01760  *
01761  */
01762 union cvmx_spemx_pf1_dbg_info {
01763     uint64_t u64;
01764     struct cvmx_spemx_pf1_dbg_info_s {
01765 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01766     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
01767     uint64_t p1_bmd_e                     : 1;  /**< A PF0 NP or P TLP was seen in the outbound path, but it was not allowed to master the bus.
01768                                                          If a PF TLP and the PCIEEP()_CFG001[ME] is not set.
01769                                                          For VF TLP, either the the PCIEEP()_CFG001[ME]/PCIEEPVF()_CFG001[ME] are not set.
01770                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM(0)_ERROR_P1_BMD_E. */
01771     uint64_t reserved_31_31               : 1;
01772     uint64_t p1_ecrc_e                    : 1;  /**< Received an PF1 ECRC error.
01773                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM(0)_ERROR_P1_ECRC_E. */
01774     uint64_t p1_rawwpp                    : 1;  /**< Received a PF1 write with poisoned payload.
01775                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM(0)_ERROR_P1_RAWWPP. */
01776     uint64_t p1_racpp                     : 1;  /**< Received a PF1 completion with poisoned payload.
01777                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM(0)_ERROR_P1_RACPP. */
01778     uint64_t p1_ramtlp                    : 1;  /**< Received a PF1 malformed TLP.
01779                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM(0)_ERROR_P1_RAMTLP. */
01780     uint64_t p1_rarwdns                   : 1;  /**< Received a request which device does not support.
01781                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM(0)_ERROR_P1_RARWDNS. */
01782     uint64_t p1_caar                      : 1;  /**< Completer PF1 aborted a request. This bit is never set because CNXXXX does not generate
01783                                                          completer aborts.
01784                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM(0)_ERROR_P1_CAAR. */
01785     uint64_t p1_racca                     : 1;  /**< Received a PF1 completion with CA status.
01786                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM(0)_ERROR_P1_RACCA. */
01787     uint64_t p1_racur                     : 1;  /**< Received a PF1 completion with UR status.
01788                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM(0)_ERROR_P1_RACUR. */
01789     uint64_t p1_rauc                      : 1;  /**< Received an PF1 unexpected completion.
01790                                                          Throws corresponding SPEM_INTSN_E::SPEM(0)_ERROR_P1_RAUC. */
01791     uint64_t reserved_0_21                : 22;
01792 #else
01793     uint64_t reserved_0_21                : 22;
01794     uint64_t p1_rauc                      : 1;
01795     uint64_t p1_racur                     : 1;
01796     uint64_t p1_racca                     : 1;
01797     uint64_t p1_caar                      : 1;
01798     uint64_t p1_rarwdns                   : 1;
01799     uint64_t p1_ramtlp                    : 1;
01800     uint64_t p1_racpp                     : 1;
01801     uint64_t p1_rawwpp                    : 1;
01802     uint64_t p1_ecrc_e                    : 1;
01803     uint64_t reserved_31_31               : 1;
01804     uint64_t p1_bmd_e                     : 1;
01805     uint64_t reserved_33_63               : 31;
01806 #endif
01807     } s;
01808     struct cvmx_spemx_pf1_dbg_info_s      cn73xx;
01809 };
01810 typedef union cvmx_spemx_pf1_dbg_info cvmx_spemx_pf1_dbg_info_t;

01868 /**
01869  * cvmx_spem#_spi_ctl
01870  */
01871 union cvmx_spemx_spi_ctl {
01872     uint64_t u64;
01873     struct cvmx_spemx_spi_ctl_s {
01874 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01875     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
01876     uint64_t start_busy                   : 1;  /**< Start/Busy status. When written with a one, indicates to the controller to
01877                                                          start a SPI transaction. The controller clears [START_BUSY] when the
01878                                                          write/read operation has completed. If the operation was a read, the
01879                                                          contents of PEM()_SPI_DATA are valid once hardware clears this bit. */
01880     uint64_t tvalid                       : 1;  /**< Reads 1 if at least one valid entry was read (preamble was valid) from EEPROM
01881                                                          and written to corresponding PEM()_SPI_DATA. Write to clear status. */
01882     uint64_t cmd                          : 3;  /**< SPI commands. The commands are the following:
01883                                                          0x0 = Reserved.
01884                                                          0x1 = WRSR: write status register. A single-byte write of
01885                                                                corresponding PEM()_SPI_DATA[DATA<7:0>] to the register.
01886                                                          0x2 = WRITE: an eight-byte page-mode write of the 64-bits of corresponding
01887                                                                PEM()_SPI_DATA to the memory array.
01888                                                          0x3 = READ: an eight-byte page-mode read access from the memory array
01889                                                                with result in the 64-bits of corresponding PEM()_SPI_DATA.
01890                                                          0x4 = WRDI: clear the write-enable latch (i.e. write protect the device).
01891                                                          0x5 = RDSR: Read status register. A single-byte read access from
01892                                                                the register with result in corresponding PEM()_SPI_DATA[DATA<7:0>].
01893                                                          0x6 = WREN: set the write-enable latch (i.e. allow writes to occur).
01894                                                          0x7 = Reserved. */
01895     uint64_t adr                          : 9;  /**< EEPROM read/write address. the byte address offset for the serial EEPROM access.
01896                                                          Since accesses are eight-byte aligned entries, <2:0> must be zero. */
01897 #else
01898     uint64_t adr                          : 9;
01899     uint64_t cmd                          : 3;
01900     uint64_t tvalid                       : 1;
01901     uint64_t start_busy                   : 1;
01902     uint64_t reserved_14_63               : 50;
01903 #endif
01904     } s;
01905     struct cvmx_spemx_spi_ctl_s           cn73xx;
01906 };
01907 typedef union cvmx_spemx_spi_ctl cvmx_spemx_spi_ctl_t;
01908 
01909 /**
01910  * cvmx_spem#_spi_data
01911  *
01912  * This register contains the most recently read or written SPI data and is unpredictable upon
01913  * power-up.
01914  */
01915 union cvmx_spemx_spi_data {
01916     uint64_t u64;
01917     struct cvmx_spemx_spi_data_s {
01918 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01919     uint64_t preamble                     : 16; /**< EEPROM PREAMBLE read or write data:
01920                                                             valid entry  = 0x9DA1
01921                                                             end-of-table = 0x6A5D
01922                                                             null         = 0xFFFF
01923                                                          Unpredictable after a PEM()_SPI_CTL[CMD]=RDSR. */
01924     uint64_t reserved_45_47               : 3;
01925     uint64_t cs2                          : 1;  /**< EEPROM CS2 bit. See PEM()_CFG_WR[ADDR<31>]. The [CS2] from
01926                                                          a valid EEPROM entry selects the type of write. When clear, an ordinary
01927                                                          configuration write. When set, a configuration mask write.
01928                                                          Unpredictable after a PEM()_SPI_CTL[CMD]=RDSR. */
01929     uint64_t adr                          : 12; /**< EEPROM configuration register address. See PEM()_CFG_WR[ADDR<11:0>].
01930                                                          The [ADR] from a valid EEPROM entry selects which configuration register
01931                                                          will be written. Note that PEM()_CFG_WR[ADDR<30:12>] of the effective
01932                                                          write are all zeroes.
01933                                                          Unpredictable after a PEM()_SPI_CTL[CMD]=RDSR. */
01934     uint64_t data                         : 32; /**< EEPROM configuration register data. See PEM()_CFG_WR[DATA].
01935                                                          HW writes the [DATA] from a valid EEPROM entry to the selected register.
01936                                                          [DATA<31:8>] are unpredictable after a PEM()_SPI_CTL[CMD]=RDSR. */
01937 #else
01938     uint64_t data                         : 32;
01939     uint64_t adr                          : 12;
01940     uint64_t cs2                          : 1;
01941     uint64_t reserved_45_47               : 3;
01942     uint64_t preamble                     : 16;
01943 #endif
01944     } s;
01945     struct cvmx_spemx_spi_data_s          cn73xx;
01946 };
01947 typedef union cvmx_spemx_spi_data cvmx_spemx_spi_data_t;
01948 
01949 /**
01950  * cvmx_spem#_strap
01951  */
01952 union cvmx_spemx_strap {
01953     uint64_t u64;
01954     struct cvmx_spemx_strap_s {
01955 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01956     uint64_t reserved_5_63                : 59;
01957     uint64_t miopem2dlm5sel               : 1;  /**< The value of the BOOT_AD<13> pin via MIO, which is captured on chip cold reset. It is not
01958                                                          affected by any other reset.  Only used for PEM2 and PEM3.  When set, PEM2/PEM3 are
01959                                                          configured to
01960                                                          DLM5/DLM6 and PEM()_QLM[PEMDLMSEL] will be set, the MAC will be configured for 2 lanes.
01961                                                          When clear, PEM2 is configured to QLM2. */
01962     uint64_t pilaneswap                   : 1;  /**< The value of PCIE_REV_LANES, which is captured on chip cold reset. It is not
01963                                                          affected by any other reset.  When set, lane swapping is performed to/from the
01964                                                          SerDes. When clear, no lane swapping is performed. */
01965     uint64_t pilanes8                     : 1;  /**< The value of PCIE*_SZ, which is captured on chip cold reset. It is not
01966                                                          affected by any other reset.  When set, the PEM0/PEM2 are configured for a maximum of
01967                                                          8-lanes, When clear, the PEM0/PEM2 are configured for a maximum of 4-lanes. */
01968     uint64_t pimode                       : 2;  /**< The value of PCIE_MODE<1:0>, which are captured on chip cold reset. They are
01969                                                          not affected by any other reset.
01970                                                          0x0 = EP mode, Gen1 speed.
01971                                                          0x1 = EP mode, Gen2 speed.
01972                                                          0x2 = EP mode, Gen3 speed.
01973                                                          0x3 = RC mode, defaults to Gen3 speed. */
01974 #else
01975     uint64_t pimode                       : 2;
01976     uint64_t pilanes8                     : 1;
01977     uint64_t pilaneswap                   : 1;
01978     uint64_t miopem2dlm5sel               : 1;
01979     uint64_t reserved_5_63                : 59;
01980 #endif
01981     } s;
01982     struct cvmx_spemx_strap_s             cn73xx;
01983 };
01984 typedef union cvmx_spemx_strap cvmx_spemx_strap_t;
01985 
01986 /**
01987  * cvmx_spem#_tlp_credits
01988  *
01989  * This register specifies the number of credits for use in moving inbound TLPs to the SLI
01990  * including peer. When this register is written, the credit values are reset to the register
01991  * value. A write to this register should take place before traffic flow starts.
01992  */
01993 union cvmx_spemx_tlp_credits {
01994     uint64_t u64;
01995     struct cvmx_spemx_tlp_credits_s {
01996 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01997     uint64_t reserved_48_63               : 16;
01998     uint64_t pem_cpl                      : 8;  /**< TLP 16B credits for completion TLPs in the peer. Legal values are 0x12 to 0x40. */
01999     uint64_t pem_np                       : 8;  /**< TLP 16B credits for nonposted TLPs in the peer. Legal values are 0x4 to 0x8. */
02000     uint64_t pem_p                        : 8;  /**< TLP 16B credits for posted TLPs in the peer. Legal values are 0x12 to 0x40. */
02001     uint64_t sli_cpl                      : 8;  /**< TLP 8B credits for completion TLPs in the SLI. Legal values are 0x24 to
02002                                                          0xFF. Pairs of PEMs share a single SLI interface. SPEM(0) and PEM(1) share one
02003                                                          SLI interface, while PEM(2) and PEM(3) share the other. When both PEMs of a pair
02004                                                          are configured, the sum of both PEMs' SLI_CPL fields must not exceed 0x100. The
02005                                                          reset value for this register assumes the minimum (e.g. 4-lane)
02006                                                          configuration. This ensures that for configurations where the total number of
02007                                                          lanes for a pair of PEMs exceeds 8, the total allocated credits does not
02008                                                          oversubscribe the SLI.
02009                                                          For configurations other than two 4-lane PEMs connected to a single SLI port,
02010                                                          software may safely reprogram this register (i.e. increase the value) to achieve
02011                                                          optimal performance.  See the following table of example configurations of PEM
02012                                                          pairs for recommended credit values.
02013                                                          <pre>
02014                                                             Configuration  PEM  Lanes  Typical [SLI_CPL]
02015                                                             --------------------------------------------
02016                                                             1 8-ln PEM     n    8             0xFF
02017                                                             2 4-ln PEMs    n    4             0x80
02018                                                                           n+1   4             0x80
02019                                                             1 4-ln PEM     n    4             0xFF
02020                                                             1 8-ln PEM,    n    8             0xAA
02021                                                             1 4-ln PEM    n+1   4             0x55
02022                                                          </pre> */
02023     uint64_t sli_np                       : 8;  /**< TLP 8B credits for nonposted TLPs in the SLI. Legal values are 0x4 to
02024                                                          0x20. Pairs of PEMs share a single SLI interface. SPEM(0) and PEM(1) share one
02025                                                          SLI interface, while PEM(2) and PEM(3) share the other. When both PEMs of a pair
02026                                                          are configured, the sum of both PEMs' SLI_NP fields must not exceed 0x20. The
02027                                                          reset value for this register assumes the minimum (e.g. 4-lane)
02028                                                          configuration. This ensures that for configurations where the total number of
02029                                                          lanes for a pair of PEMs exceeds 8, the total allocated credits does not
02030                                                          oversubscribe the SLI.
02031                                                          For configurations other than two 4-lane PEMs connected to a single SLI port,
02032                                                          software may safely reprogram this register (i.e. increase the value) to achieve
02033                                                          optimal performance.  See the following table of example configurations of PEM
02034                                                          pairs for recommended credit values.
02035                                                          <pre>
02036                                                             Configuration  PEM  Lanes  Typical [SLI_CPL]
02037                                                             --------------------------------------------
02038                                                             1 8-ln PEM     n    8             0x20
02039                                                             2 4-ln PEMs    n    4             0x10
02040                                                                           n+1   4             0x10
02041                                                             1 4-ln PEM     n    4             0x20
02042                                                             1 8-ln PEM,    n    8             0x15
02043                                                             1 4-ln PEM    n+1   4             0x0B
02044                                                          </pre> */
02045     uint64_t sli_p                        : 8;  /**< TLP 8B credits for Posted TLPs in the SLI. Legal values are 0x24 to 0xFF. Pairs
02046                                                          of PEMs share a single SLI interface. SPEM(0) and PEM(1) share one SLI interface,
02047                                                          while PEM(2) and PEM(3) share the other. When both PEMs of a pair are
02048                                                          configured, the sum of both PEMs' SLI_P fields must not exceed 0x100. The reset
02049                                                          value for this register assumes the minimum (e.g. 4-lane) configuration. This
02050                                                          ensures that for configurations where the total number of lanes for a pair of
02051                                                          PEMs exceeds 8, the total allocated credits does not oversubscribe the SLI.
02052                                                          For configurations other than two 4-lane PEMs connected to a single SLI port,
02053                                                          software may safely reprogram this register (i.e. increase the value) to achieve
02054                                                          optimal performance.  See the following table of example configurations of PEM
02055                                                          pairs for recommended credit values.
02056                                                          <pre>
02057                                                             Configuration  PEM  Lanes  Typical [SLI_CPL]
02058                                                             --------------------------------------------
02059                                                             1 8-ln PEM     n    8             0xFF
02060                                                             2 4-ln PEMs    n    4             0x80
02061                                                                           n+1   4             0x80
02062                                                             1 4-ln PEM     n    4             0xFF
02063                                                             1 8-ln PEM,    n    8             0xAA
02064                                                             1 4-ln PEM    n+1   4             0x55
02065                                                          </pre> */
02066 #else
02067     uint64_t sli_p                        : 8;
02068     uint64_t sli_np                       : 8;
02069     uint64_t sli_cpl                      : 8;
02070     uint64_t pem_p                        : 8;
02071     uint64_t pem_np                       : 8;
02072     uint64_t pem_cpl                      : 8;
02073     uint64_t reserved_48_63               : 16;
02074 #endif
02075     } s;
02076     struct cvmx_spemx_tlp_credits_s       cn73xx;
02077 };
02078 typedef union cvmx_spemx_tlp_credits cvmx_spemx_tlp_credits_t;
02079 
02080 #endif
